title: Edgar Marín
text:
Edgar Ceferino Marín Leví (born 22 May 1943) is a Costa Rican retired <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Pueblo%20Nuevo%2C%20Puntarenas">Pueblo Nuevo</a>, <a href="Puntarenas%20Province">Puntarenas</a>, Marín made his league debut in 1962 for <a href="Deportivo%20Saprissa">Deportivo Saprissa</a> against <a href="Club%20Sport%20Uruguay%20de%20Coronado">Uruguay de Coronado</a> and played for them until 1967 before moving to the <a href="North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20%281968%E2%80%9384%29">NASL</a> to play for the <a href="Oakland%20Clippers">Oakland Clippers</a> and <a href="Kansas%20City%20Spurs">Kansas City Spurs</a>. He also failed tests for <a href="PEC%20Zwolle">PEC Zwolle</a> and <a href="Go%20Ahead%20Eagles">Go Ahead Eagles</a> in the Netherlands.
Marín won 12 <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20Costa%20Rica">Primera División de Costa Rica</a> titles with <a href="Deportivo%20Saprissa">Deportivo Saprissa</a> during the 1960s and 1970s. He won six consecutive titles from 1972 to 1977.
International career.
Marín also represented <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a> at the international level, representing his country in 10 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches. He won a total of 32 caps, scoring 4 goals.
He retired in 1979.
